attributes.action: Boycott American trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected US president
attributes.background: This petition supports the boycott of US trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected president.  Trump endorses a manifesto built on intolerance and a lack of respect for the natural resources we should be protecting.  The implications of his election would impact far beyond the US borders.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cbsnews.com/media/is-donald-trump-a-menace-to-the-global-economy/

http://edition.cnn.com/2015/12/07/politics/donald-trump-muslim-ban-immigration/

http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/may/04/donald-trumps-election-will-derail-paris-climate-deal-warns-its-architect

http://www.wsj.com/articles/world-leaders-assess-a-potential-donald-trump-presidency-1462739253

http://www.nationalreview.com/article/434660/donald-trump-foreign-policy-incoherent-shallow

attributes.action: Orgnanise a blockade of the Libyan coast to stop people trafficking.
attributes.background: Around 150,000 migrants travelled from Libya to Italy by boat last year and, so far this year, more than 37,000 people have been intercepted in the Mediterranean and taken to Italian ports. Hundreds are believed to have died after their overloaded vessels sank or capsized.
attributes.additional_details: Lord West, ex-First Sealord and Chief of Naval Staff, said such a measure would require 10 Navy frigates and destroyers, along with helicopters, drones and other intelligence and surveillance capability

attributes.action: Products with lithium batteries to have a child-safe fastening and quantum coat
attributes.background: Rising incidence of 'button batteries' containing lithium manganese cause serious/fatal injuries in children. There are 3,000 ingestions of these batteries p.a. and 48 deaths. The NHS recently issued a public announcement re dangers, following 5 serious injuries and 1 fatality in NW England alone.
attributes.additional_details:
1) The incidence of button battery injuries in the North West of England:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-29610570

2) http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2969115/How-small-batteries-new-child-killer-look-innocuous-cause-utterly-horrific-internal-burns.html

3) Statistical analysis:
www.poison.org/battery/fatalcases

4) http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/two-year-old-girl-dies-after-swallowing-button-battery-over-christmas-in-us-a6793846.html

attributes.action: An alternative intergrated solution to Heathrow airport expansion
attributes.background:
Heathrow expansion can only exasperate West London’s housing and congestion problems.
I believe London’s future success and those of rest of UK will best be served by deliberately planning to reduce pressures on London's limited resources. 
Hence this proposal as a two prong solution.
attributes.additional_details:
1)Build a *new* international airport(linked to HS2), of similar size to Heathrow, around Birmingham. 
2)Divert half of all Heathrow's contracts to the new airport. Reducing pressures on London's resources. 
Some of the benefits are
•Sharing traffic between West/North of London. 
•More passenger capacity than a single runway extension.
•Help tourism/service industry in the north of UK. 
•In Emergencies, as both airports are of similar size, they can better cope with diversion of air traffic.

attributes.action: Allow all students access to clean water during school time.
attributes.background: In many school across the country students have been denied access to clean water during school. Even though everyone in our country has clean, fresh running water that is accessible to everyone many school do not allow students to get water during lessons and school. We cannot allow this to happen

attributes.action: Vote that the house has no confidence in the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: He's not fit to hold the office of Prime Minister because he has knowingly put the UK in a position which he believed will undermine the security of the UK, destabilise Europe and the world economy, diminish the capabilities of our intelligence services and will cause mass unemployment.
attributes.additional_details: He has without necessity called for a referendum which could result in the UKs exit from the EU believing it will be ruinous to the nation.  In numerous speeches made by himself and his ministers have made it abundantly clear that he considers a possible exit from the EU would be disastrous for the economic welfare and security of the nation. He's therefore been derelict in his duty to defend the nation against threat by setting in motion a chain of events he believes will harm the UK.

attributes.action: Move parliament to "Skegness". UK Parliament tour seaside resorts during refurb.
attributes.background: Due to 6 years of repairs to the Palace of Westminster,  parliament will be held in a different location. This petition asks the government to discuss touring seaside towns during the repairs. This would utilise our vast holiday park infrustucture, facilitate regenerration and showcase democracy.

attributes.action: Debate parking on pavements. This practice is a danger to all
attributes.background: I went blind just last year, I have sustained many injuries walking into parked cars, I was even hit on the main road by a hit and run car and sustained minor injuries. I am afraid now to go out. The practice is a danger for disabled, the Blind, Children & Mothers with push chairs.
attributes.additional_details:
This dangerous practice is an obstruction for Disabled people and Mothers with pushchairs and young children having to be forced into the road to pass the vehicle and is a very dangerous manoeuvre I have hundreds of photographs of cars, vans and large lorries parked fully on the footpath and other cars illegally parked which can be sent if you need them. 
And copies of statements of people on social media who believe it is their god given right to park on the pavement outside their house.

attributes.action: Cycling revolution will cure the nation’s poor health.
attributes.background: 67% of men and 57% of women in the UK are overweight or obese. Coronary heart disease , stroke, type 2 diabetes, colon cancer , breast cancer, osteoarthritis , depression , dementia are just some of the diseases that can be prevented/delayed by doing regular exercise...
attributes.additional_details:
Imagine how much money could be saved by the NHS (£115 billion spent p.a.) if the population was healthier. This money should be spent on the following:
-More bike stands throughout the UK, a significant increase in Boris bikes and the introduction of Boris bikes in every city in the UK.
-A mass education program about the benefits of cycling in primary schools, secondary schools, universities and work places throughout the UK.
-Cycling facilities (e.g. lockers, secure bike sheds, showers) in the locations mentioned above.
-Longer cycle superhighways in London and superhighways in every city in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce laws to prevent companies using pension funds for any other purpose
attributes.background: Companies are continually reporting a black hole in pension funds also when companies go bust the pension fund is empty.

attributes.action: Change the law to stop insurance companies discrimating against people with HIV
attributes.background: Currently people living with HIV, who are healthy and who's health is not at risk can pay astronomically more than those who are not living with the condition when taking out travel insurance. This is compunded by people with the condition being completely discounted from certain insurance cover.

attributes.action: Change the law so a Hit and Run driver must serve a life sentence.
attributes.background: Off late there has be a number of Hit and Run Road Traffic incidents where on conviction the vehicle driver was only given a period in prison that in no way reflects the callousness of the crime and the devastating effect this type of crime has on the victims family.

attributes.action: Make a ‘car mode’ setting a mandatory feature on all new smartphones.
attributes.background:
We believe that car mode will reduce the number of accidents on our roads.
Specifically, car mode would, when activated, and until such time it was turned off. Disable all phone calls, text messages and any form of application-based alerts that require the user to interact with the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
26% of all car accidents were caused by drivers using a mobile device (1 in 4). Connected Driver Survey 2015 - MORI Social Research Inst. 

Dialing a phone increases you chance of having an accident by 12 times while reading or writing a text increases your chances of having an accident tenfold.
According to a RAC Foundation survey, 60% of people "would be happy to use a 'vehicle safe mode' on external devices in cars."

attributes.action: Disband the polices current internal complaints investigation Service & the IPCC
attributes.background:
Two years ago the government voted to allow police to investigate All matters internally.

Instead of putting all cases, of police assualts against civilians or common law breaches, straight to the CPS, 

They now get a chance to cover up the matter or potentially 'falsify' the evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The current police complaints system, is currently full of potential:

1. Corruption.

2. Conflict of interest - of the investigators knowing the person or persons that they are investigating.

3. Power or knowledge to potentially contaminate the incidence.

4. Potential or knowledge of how to falsify the evidence and manipulate the witness's:

    A. By only asking the right question or by
    misleading the witness into saying the right 
    answer, to allow the true police criminal to walk.

attributes.action: Cap CSA payments at set weekly amount regardless of income.
attributes.background: CSA payments are currently worked out based on the ex partners income. If you're on benefits you pay £5 per week. If you're earning £36,000 per year it goes to over £100 per week for a child and continues going up with each pound earned. Cap the CSA payments to child benefit amounts!
attributes.additional_details: CSA payment calculator. Works out 15% of gross income for one child, 17% for 2 children and 19% for 3 or more children. On £36,000 per year for 3 children this is £567 per month. Leaving the payee with £1700 per month to live on. This is unfair on the payee.

attributes.action: Call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to engage with constituents
attributes.background: Every four years, EU citizens vote on democratic representatives in the European Parliament (MEPs). Very few people know who their MEP is. If the UK votes to stay in the European Union, the Government must call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to be more accessible and open to constituents.
attributes.additional_details: Various surveys showing how much people in the UK know about their MEP http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2014/may/10/voters-cant-name-their-mep http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/hands-up-if-you-know-who-your-mep-is-8679242.html

attributes.action: We want a referendum to be held on English membership of the United kingdom.
attributes.background: England would be stronger outside the United Kingdom for the simple reason that Scotland, Wales and Northern island  contribute far less to the Union than they take out. As a result of this England would be stronger outside the UK.

attributes.action: Put a cap on the monthly rent payments for individuals in the UK
attributes.background: In the county of Dorset the average rent payment for an individual is £400 per month. If an individual is earning the minimum UK wage at £7.00, and working a 40 hour week, this means that almost 50% of their earnings are going towards paying their landlord.
attributes.additional_details:
Considering the high expense of life in general, including rates for food and living costs, car insurance, telephone bills and the other monthly expenditures, this means that tenants are paying a high rate for other important items.
Considering this, the base line is that we in the UK are LIVING TO WORK. This has to change.

My intention is that parliament puts a cap for landlords at 30% of a monthly wage based on minimum wage for tenants in each county.

attributes.action: Equalise public spending per capita throughout the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland get higher payments per capita than England. This is unreasonable. All countries in the UK should receive the same amount per capita.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014/15, public spending per capita in the UK as a whole was £8,913. In England, it was £8,638 (3% below the UK average). This compares with:
• Scotland: £10,374 (16% above the UK average – 20% higher than England)
• Wales: £9,904 (11% above the UK average – 14.7% higher than England)
• Northern Ireland £11,106 (25% above the UK average – 28.6% higher than England).
(Data source: House of Commons Briefing Paper Number 04300, 8 March 2015)

attributes.action: Build a gas-powered station at Hinckley Point instead of a nuclear station.
attributes.background: The South West needs a new power station to avoid blackouts in the next decade. It is increasingly clear that a nuclear station cannot be completed in less than 20 years. The enormous amount of money saved can be spent developing tidal power in the Severn Estuary. It is time to think again.
attributes.additional_details: We need low carbon base-load power. Nuclear would, in theory, provide this. However, tidal power could provide a better, safer solution. The sister nuclear stations at Olkiluoto 3 in Finland and Flamanville in France are billions of Euros over budget and years behind schedule. There is no reason to think Hinckley will be completed on time and to budget. EDF know this, both governments know it and the Chinese require an indemnity from us because they know it. We can build an LNG dock for the gas.

attributes.action: Call on the government to publicly confirm support for strong encryption.
attributes.background: The government should not erode the security of our devices or applications, pressure companies to keep and allow government access to our data, mandate implementation of vulnerabilities or backdoors into products or have disproportionate access to the keys to  our private data.
attributes.additional_details:
The public demands privacy, security, and integrity for their communications and devices. As a public, we should be confident that the services we use haven’t been weakened or compromised by government mandate or pressure. No legislation or private agreement with the government should undermine our rights.

Weakening encryption weakens the entire Internet. Endorse strong encryption and encourage other world governments to do the same.

attributes.action: Make drifting in an empty open space legal
attributes.background: People all over the country put people in danger by drifting on roads and getting "section 59's" for drifting around in an empty car park, we need to get people off the road and let the people enjoy some fun off-road and out of harms way of the public.
attributes.additional_details: I have known people to drift in an empty open car park safely and receive cautions and/or had their cars seized.  If this is done safely and away from members of the public then why penalise them?

attributes.action: To revoke the need to provide a certificate of destruction for these vehicles.
attributes.background: The petition can be divided into 3 categories: 1.Heritage -Save many rare classic vehicles from destruction. 2.Economic -makes no sense financially.Costs more to destroy a valuable commodity resulting in lower value scrap. 3.Impact on the environment -no evidence the scheme helps the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Huge Public interest and media following to save these vehicles and in doing so protect our motoring heritage and boost trade within the classic car sector.

attributes.action: Only British Born Citizens can have: Health Care - Benefits / Housing / Voting
attributes.background: Only British Born Citizens have rights to: Government owned or sponsored Health Care & Housing / Benefits / Voting. Citizens living in the country 20 or more years can have the same rights if they already have British citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Just trying to save UK from outside influences usually only British born citizens and long standing citizens really care about the country and there fellow neighbors.

attributes.action: Parliament to legislate to require employers to reply to all job applications
attributes.background: Increasingly unsuccessful candidates never receive a notification that their application has been unsuccessful which is unacceptable. Looking for a job is stressful and employers should be sensitive to this and  reply to all applicants. It is just common courtesy

attributes.action: Let children go on holiday when they like & keep schools open 253 days a year.
attributes.background: Many families are priced out of holidays because traditional school holidays cause peaks in demand. If schools are open all year round families can synchronise their holiday to suit their work commitments. Schools can then arrange catch up lessons for children who have been on holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Long summer holidays disrupt children`s education and inhibit learning.

The economy of the country would benefit as families would not have to rely on expensive holiday child care.

Industry would benefit from parents not having to take time off work due to child care commitments.

Children will receive more education creating a better educated society.

Parents will avoid being fined for taking children out of school.

More full time jobs would be created rather than seasonal employment.

attributes.action: Prevent women from fighting in close combat roles in the British Armed Forces.
attributes.background:
- If a woman wants to serve on the frontline, they need to meet the same physical criteria as men, otherwise lives will be put at risk.
- It would cause discontent among serving members of the armed forces, with many threatening to leave if this becomes policy.
attributes.additional_details:
- Women should not qualify for combat roles with lower physical capabilities, for example they might have to carry a heavy male, with full armour to save his life.

- It would cloud judgement of male counterparts, who would instinctively choose to save a woman if two people's lives were in danger, despite not always being the right decision to take.

- Women, in the main, cannot carry 110lb on their back (as soldiers in Afghanistan did).

- There are already many combat roles open to women.

attributes.action: Make legal, business's over a certain size MUST pay double time on bank holidays
attributes.background: To make it a legal right that business's over a certain size MUST pay double time for bank holidays.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for public institutions to recycle
attributes.background: Most public institutions, including some sectors of the NHS and many school and colleges across the UK don't recycle. This can lead to much paper and plastic waste, we normally recycle at home, being taken to landfill instead.
attributes.additional_details: In the average school, 500 plastic bottles are used a day, ending in landfill. Alongside this is the countless sheets of paper and card thrown away by schools. The NHS similarly has little are no recycling bins for public use. This is replicated in parks and towns across the country, with all the plastic and paper waste we use when in public going to landfill, when it could, and should, be recycled.

attributes.action: Make openly threatening the stability of UK society in public a criminal offence
attributes.background: Being British is about respect and tolerance; public use of hateful language, threats, actions and gestures aimed against UK society and values is becoming too common; it can be seen in media almost daily around the UK and is getting far worse. This causes fear and division and should be illegal.

attributes.action: Ban the use of opinion polls in the run up to elections and referenda.
attributes.background: Opinion polls have become tools for influencing people's voting decisions and should be completely banned.
attributes.additional_details: The 2015 General Election was badly affected by them and so will the EU referendum.

attributes.action: Make dog ownership require certified training and registered accountability.
attributes.background: Dogs are potentially dangerous animals whose behaviour should be governed appropriately. Handler training equips owners with skills and techniques needed to ensure safe standards of behaviour. Recognised registration of ownership of an animal would give traceable and enforceable accountability.

attributes.action: The £829,000 should be written off by the MOD.
attributes.background: Around a decade ago army pilots were paid retention bonuses. This amounted to £829,000 in total. Some of these bonuses were overpaid due to an administrative error. It costs around £3.6 million to train an Apache helicopter pilot. Losing pilots due to low morale and persecution is not worth the cost
attributes.additional_details: Around a decade ago Army pilots were overpaid retention bonuses due to an administrative error. These overpayments amounted to £829,000 in total. It costs about £3.6m to train an Apache pilot.  At least 15 pilots have already resigned over the action being taken by the MOD. The MOD should just write this error off and stop pursuing the individual pilots.

attributes.action: We believe the Government should increase fuel duty to protect PIP payments.
attributes.background:
In this year's Budget, the Chancellor made changes to PIP.
The role of Government is to protect the most vulnerable.
By cutting PIP payments, the Government is taking away a vital source of income to those who need it the most.
We believe fuel duty should be increased by 2p a litre to protect PIP

attributes.action: Introduce nutrition, the law and tax system in to the primary curriculum
attributes.background:
Many people don't appear to have enough understanding of nutrition, law and taxes.
With introducing or further implimenting these subjects in to the classroom we can help combat the increasing health epidemic, reduce overall debt, and help reduce the chances of incarceration from an early age.

attributes.action: Deport Foreign Criminals Earlier Increase ERS Scheme Time from 9 to 18 months
attributes.background: A Foreign Criminal cost the same as a Uk Criminal Depending on the Prison a Prisoner cost the tax payers up to 33,000 pounds and year , deporting a foreign criminal early to there home country up to 18 months before their sentence expires will save huge amounts of money
attributes.additional_details: there is over 10,000 foreign criminals in uk prisons , giving them enough time off as an incentive will help them in there decision whether to stay and fight to remain or voluntarily request to be removed. Most criminals will jump at the opportunity to be sent back to there home country 18 months early rather than the 9 months already in place under the ERs scheme with the home office

attributes.action: Ask Saudi government to stop executing young innocent people
attributes.background: Saudi government has arrested 17 years old innocent Ali Nammer . Now the family has been threatened that they will execute him in next 24 hours . We request to put pressure on Saudi authorities to cancel their decision and release them

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against the ACWY strain of meningitis
attributes.background: My son contracted the Men W strain of meningococcal septacimia at age 20 months in April 2015, he was extremely poorly and got turned away from 3 health professionals as having a virus until I went by my cut instinct and took him to the children's hospital. He had no rash and we almost lost him.
attributes.additional_details:
Cases of meningitis and septicaemia due to Men W have been increasing in England, from 22 cases in 2009 to 117 in 2014. The increase seems to be speeding up in 2015, caused by an aggressive strain of the bug. But it's fatal in about 1 in 10 cases and can lead to long-term health problems.
Men W infections are particularly severe and usually need to be treated in intensive care. They have a higher death rate than the more common Men C and Men B strains.

attributes.action: End the supply of alcoholic drinks to MP's / Peers in the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.background:
MP's and Peers are able to purchase alcoholic drinks at a subsidized price at bars in the palace of Westminster costing the tax payer over £4million per year.
As a place of work Westminster should be kept dry with provision of food and soft drinks only. our MPs should vote with a clear head.

attributes.action: Stop the increment of car insurance premium with "No Blame" accidents.
attributes.background: Lot of insurance companies increasing the insurance premium of the drivers who were involved in "no blame " accidents. Many driver got hit from behind by another driver while on stall position and ended up paying 30% extra insurance premium during their next renewal. This is unfair for many drivers.
attributes.additional_details: Many people around the UK paying extra car insurance premium just for getting involved in an accident, despite it wasn't their fault at all. I have been hit by a speeding vehicle while waiting in the traffic light and my insurance now gone up by 110%. I spoke to many people around the country and they are suffering from the same fate. This is very fraudulent behavior of the insurance companies to form out money from both parties with any excuse. "No blame" accident sufferers should not pay extra

attributes.action: Introduce a Financial Transaction Tax, use revenue to help fight austerity cuts
attributes.background: A Financial Transaction Tax is designed to stabilise market volatility by acting as a disincentive to short term risky financial transactions, such as high frequency trading. These financial transactions were a leading cause of the global financial crisis. Impose an FTT to stabilise the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The financial crisis caused massive socio-economic human rights violations through austerity measures. An FTT would promote less risky, long term investments which lead to a stronger and more stable economy that benefits all and not just the City. Use the generated tax revenue - European Commission estimate £8bn for the UK - to help fight back cuts to the public sector.

attributes.action: To implement a minimum wage for people under the age of 16.
attributes.background: This is part of a GCSE Citizenship campaign that is to bring about change in society. We are a group of 14 and 15 year olds that feel the need to make a change. This campaign is worth supporting because it is to bring about equality and make a change in society.

attributes.action: Change the NLA guidelines to allow mobile workers to be paid for travel.
attributes.background: In September 2015 the CJEU ruled that the time spent by mobile workers - that is, those who have no fixed place of work - travelling between home and their first and last place of work each day counts as 'working time' under the WTD and WTR. However payment for these hours is down to national law.
attributes.additional_details: National law in this case is the NLA formely the National Minimum Wage which states that travel time between home and a place of work is excluded from the obligation to pay the NMW, including for mobile workers. This is unfair and mind boggling considering that a court has ruled that travel time under the WTD and WTR that safeguard workers to make sure they have regulated breaks and rest periods as work but does not govern pay for these hours. I therefore would like this to be addressed.

attributes.action: Pour more money into science and biotech
attributes.background: Stem cell research at Cambridge and Imperial, Medicine at Oxford and London etc are all world-leading. Therefore, the UK has some of the best in the world.  We have pioneered so many new techniques and technologies here, we should be incredibly proud of it. We should fund it however difficult.
attributes.additional_details:
We just unveiled a new DNA project too to sequence 100,000 genomes. That sort of stuff is awesome and will make a huge difference in 5-10 years. We also have a stem cell bank at Cambridge, and we should expand that and make it the best in the world. That would be tremendously powerful for analysing health outcomes, risks and helping people prevent diseases. To that end we need only 30% percent reduction in military spending. Imagine what we can do then.
We can pay for science more that way.

attributes.action: Give the vote to all children over the age of 11
attributes.background: I want children to be able to decide what country is being molded for them as at the moment they have to simply sit back and watch their country fall apart politically and quietly resign. We need a voice as at the moment we are gagged, unable to decide what "our" country needs.
attributes.additional_details: Petition Formed By Sebastian Rumfitt, aged 13

attributes.action: Ban and shoot down drones flying near airports before the inevitable happens.
attributes.background:
Did we get enough near misses to realise that we have a problem?
Drones can now carry a 10 lbs charge, which could destroy an airplane in midair.

Each airport needs military equipment to track down and neutralise drones that violate the restricted airspace.

attributes.action: Ensure HIV treatment and support services receive the funding they need
attributes.background: HIV treatment and support services are vital for those who rely on them and for the wider public health of society. In the context of cuts to public health budgets, the Government must make provision to ensure that the integral role HIV services play is protected.

attributes.action: Give More benefits and income allowance for single parents In higher education
attributes.background: Single parent families are not given enough support or income to gain qualifications for highly paid employment to surpport their children and make a better and secure future for them selves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
Maintenance grants replaced with Maintenon loans 
Denied housing benefit if return to full time higher education 
Lack of support for child care

attributes.action: Give agency staff permanent contracts by law after 6 months with same company
attributes.background: Agency workers are used by companies as a disposable resource. Yes not all staff want to stay with the same company, but the majority do. All agency workers want is a permanent contract, fair working wage, and conditions after 6 months working for a company that clearly needs them. No exceptions!
attributes.additional_details:
I currently work for a company through an agency in the North East UK.
I have been told on numerous occasions, that
"the company" has stated that NO ONE will be given permanent contracts for my job description, only certain departments offer contracts and that is EXTREMELY rare. 
Many of the staff on my department have worked with this company for over 2 years and are STILL being told by bosses things like "if you don't come in this Saturday (voluntary overtime) we'll just replace you"

attributes.action: Allow dogs to visit consenting long staying patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Research in America has demonstrated the uplifting effects experienced by both patients and staff when dogs are allowed to wander around hospital corridors and wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs probably will not directly help a human to recover from illness, but dogs make humans happy. And feeling happy does make humans more likely to recover from illness.

The petitioner has been unable to find evidence of any diseases which are carried by dogs being transmitted to humans. 

How many diseases can you think of which a dog can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

How many diseases can you think of which a human can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?
